Summary Currently, I enjoy heading a stellar creative department and leading creative from concept to product. I'm an integrated creative that combines digital, print, experiential, social and video. Recently, I've had the pleasure of working with Bombay Sapphire, TriBeCa Film Festival, Mumm Napa, J.P. Wiser's, Bacardi, Uncommon, Oxley and D'Usse.  
 
For over 15 years, I've run lean as a sole creative and flush as an integral member of a team. I've tackled packaging, liquor, entertainment, branding and pharma. I've strategized for new pitches, designed cohesive multi-channel tactics, videos, games, apps, websites and paid media, run a nationally-distributed literary and art magazine, concepted new business and product launch materials, and created sales and branding materials. 
 
Specialties:  
Creative and art direction 
Integrated campaign concepts & strategy 
Creative ideation, look & feel and design  
Device agnostic web design 
App design 
Video concepts and storyboards 
Branding 
Digital Art creation 
Game and puzzle concepts

Think it. Visualize it. Make it. Burn with creative fire.

Responsible for the creation and management of creative from concept to completion. Summary My 14-year career includes working in a wide variety of companies: From ATL agencies to purely digital hot shops.  
 
Half of it took place in London, where I worked in places like Fallon, Lean Mean Fighting Machine, Digitas, among others. These were challenging years and I've worked as a senior creative on projects for global brands like Unilever, Eurostar, Sony, Guinness and a few others.  
 
In 2010 I moved to fast-paced São Paulo, Brazil, where I'm currently based. Here I worked as a Creative Director at AgenciaClickIsobar, responsible for the integrated FIAT account and later had the same role for Nivea.  
 
After a prolific stint at AgenciaClick, in March 2012 I left to found the creative lab SEÑORES, with a few collaborators based in NYC and London. It's focused on developing high impact communication and innovation projects. Both coming from a client's brief or proprietary, which turns out to be at the same time hugely fun and daunting. 
 
In between all that, back in 2011, I've started running a creativity workshop at MiamiAdSchool. Thankfully, it became a great success among creatives and planners and we had people from the likes of Nike and Google Creative Labs taking part.  
 
Life's been busy in the tropics.

Summary Colin is a Creative Director with 14 years of experience at traditional and digital agencies across the country. Starting his career at TBWA Chiat NY then moving onto Cliff Freeman, McCann NY, Hal Riney SF, Crispin, R/GA, and GREY NY. Just before joining Sid Lee he was at Google Creative Labs and 72andSunny NY.  
He’s been on some iconic brands such as Samsung, Merrell, Smirnoff, Crown Royal, NFL, VW, Burger King, Google and Nike. Most notably his Domino’s Pizza Tracker work which is recognized as best digital of the decade by One Club and his Nike Film Room work that taught kids how to ball like their favorite superstars. His work has been recognized by Cannes, One Show, D&AD, AICP, Andy’s, Clios, Communication Arts, Art Directors Club, Tomorrow Awards, Webby's, SXSW and LIA.  
At Sid Lee his main focus is to bring integrated thinking and use his experience to lead teams to create famous work.

Alex Ohannessian (otherwise known as ohanna / ohannanana / alex o.).  
 
I work. Creative at Publicis Seattle. Previously, freelanced around New York at BBH, 360i and Publicis for over a year. Before that, worked full-time at BBDO/Proximity NY (Sr. Art Director) working mainly on Visa (FIFA, Olympics, Signature and Prepaid). I also spent some years at SapientNitro (Coca-Cola & Powerade - FIFA) and at AlmaDDB (StateFarm, McDonald's and Pepsi).  
 
Experienced in both digital and traditional advertising. I love every part of the creative process, specially the ideating / concepting stages. My focus is art direction, but I write whenever possible (I have done some of the writing on past agency and personal projects). Have worked on several sports centered projects.  
 
I teach. I have been an instructor at Miami Ad School since 2010 - taught Everything is Media, Interactive Concepts and Head to Head (competitions class) both at the Miami and Brooklyn locations. I have also done guest lectures at NYU and have been a part-time lecturer at the University of Miami.  
 
Family guy. Married to Nadia. Parents of Toulouse (our shiny-gray-coat Weimaraner).  
 
Football. Fútbol. ˈfo͝otˌbôl. I seem to gravitate towards soccer a bit - at work, at home or at a stadium (Nacional and Uruguay) and sometimes, on the pitch.  
 
Musician. I play guitar (+ some charango) and sing [badly]. Compose music and lyrics whenever possible. Slightly obsessed with trying to play Hendrix songs. Used to play in a band [TrecePuentes], which is how I met my wife [great success / case study for being in a band]. 
 
My next music goal is to record an album (some day) and learn Lou Reed's Perfect Day on the piano (just the one song, play it at a party and when people ask for more say "but I'm le tired…").  
 
Montevideo [Uruguay] → Miami → NYC → Seattle 
[Buffalo, Iowa, Puerto Rico, & Madrid in between].
